meanings.definition: The state or condition of being compelled or forced to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her compulsiveness to clean the house every day was exhausting.
meanings.sent2: His compulsiveness to check his phone constantly was becoming a problem.
meanings.sent3: His compulsiveness to organize his sock drawer by color made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The compulsiveness of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The compulsiveness of the ticking clock filled the room with tension.

meanings.definition: The quality of being difficult to resist or control.
meanings.sent1: The compulsiveness of his sweet tooth made it hard for him to stick to a healthy diet.
meanings.sent2: The compulsiveness of her need for perfectionism often caused her stress.
meanings.sent3: The compulsiveness of his love for ice cream led to a freezer full of different flavors.
meanings.sent4: The compulsiveness of the music drew her to the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The compulsiveness of the puppy's wagging tail was impossible to ignore.
